com.avaya.cmapi

Class ServiceProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avaya.cmapi.ServiceProvider

  • public abstract class ServiceProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    The starting point to get access to CSTA services and the Avaya extensions to CSTA services. To use any service:
    1. Acquire an instance of ServiceProvider by using the getServiceProvider method.
    2. Optionally, set the characteristics of the ServiceProvider session by using the setSessionCharacteristics method.
    3. Acquire an instance of each service to be used in the application by using the getService method for each.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.8 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • getServiceProvider

        public static ServiceProvider getServiceProvider(java.util.Properties properties)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an instance of a ServiceProvider based on the specified properties.

        Properties is of type java.util.Properties. The following properties must be set:

        Property NameProperty Value
        cmapi.server_ip set to IP address or hostname of the Communication Manager API connector server
        cmapi.server_port set to port number of the connector server
        cmapi.username set to username of the application (Not currently verified)
        cmapi.password set to password of the application (Not currently verified)

        * The following properties may be set as optional:

        Property NameProperty Value
        cmapi.session_cleanup_delay Set to a timer value in seconds. After the loss of the connection to the client machine is detected, the session will not be terminated until this timer expires. It is possible to resume the session with reconnect() if the session is not terminated. This timer defaults to 0 for backwards compatibility purposes, but it is recommended that it be set to a higher value, such as 60.
        cmapi.session_duration_timer Set to a timer value in seconds. This is a timer to maintain active heart beat between the client application and the server. If the heart beat is not received within this timer value, then the server will assume the client application is terminated. This timer defaults to 180 sec. and the allowed range is between 30 sec. and 2 hours. However, if this value is set to a big number, then the server would take a long time to detect the client application is gone away.
        cmapi.session_id Set to the session ID to resume. This property is used to resume the session with getServiceProvider(). If the API reconnect() is used, then the session ID stored internally is used to resume the session.
        cmapi.application_description Optionally put the name or a short description of your application. This may be used by the server in the future to display currently registered applications.

        ServiceProvider will look for the values of these fields from the following places in this order:

        1. System properties set on the command line (supercedes all others) (Recommended only for temporary settings for debugging purposes)
        2. Properties object passed into getServiceProvider method (Recommended)
        3. cmapi-client.properties file (Not recommended)

        The application can set up the properties object and get a service provider instance like this: 

         Properties properties = new Properties();
 properties.setProperty ("cmapi.server_ip", "132.7.82.40");
 properties.setProperty ("cmapi.server_port", "4721");
 properties.setProperty ("cmapi.username", "application1");
 properties.setProperty ("cmapi.password", "secretpasswd");
 properties.setProperty ("cmapi.session_duration_timer", "300"); // Min=30, Max=7200 secs
 properties.setProperty ("cmapi.session_cleanup_delay", "60"); // Min=0, Max=7200 secs
 ServiceProvider servProv = ServiceProvider.getServiceProvider(properties);
        If you wish to just use the properties as they are specified in either the cmapi-client.properties file and/or System properties (neither is recommended), then your code may look like this: 
         ServiceProvider servProv = ServiceProvider.getServiceProvider(null);

        The properties will be used to establish a relationship with the switching function to be used to provide the underlying telephony services.

        Parameters:
        properties - a set of parameters necessary for identifying the address and port of the connector server and the name and password of the application
        Returns:
        a ServiceProvider instance which provides access to CSTA services
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • getService

        public abstract java.lang.Object getService(java.lang.String serviceName)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves the service that is specified with a fully qualified interface name. Valid services include, but are not necessarily limited to:
        • DeviceServices
        • TerminalServices
        • PhysicalDeviceServices
        • VoiceUnitServices
        • ExtendedVoiceUnitServices
        • ToneDetectionServices
        • ToneCollectionServices
        • MonitoringServices

        For example, to request an instance of TerminalServices, use: 

         TerminalServices termServ = (TerminalServices)servProv.getService
        (com.avaya.csta.terminal.TerminalServices.class.getName());
        Parameters:
        serviceName - fully qualified interface name of service
        Returns:
        Instance of requested interface. Must be cast to appropriate interface type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • reconnect

        public abstract void reconnect()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Reconnects to the cmapi server and re-estabilshes the previous session. Once the connection is remade to the server successfully, the previous active session is resumed automatically.
        • If the previous session has expired or the reconnection itself has failed, then an exception is thrown to indicate the failure of the reconnect().
        • If reconnect() is called while the session is already active, then reconnect() is ignored.
        • If the reconnection succeeds and the previous session is resumed succesfully, then reconnect() returns without an exception.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs
        com.avaya.api.sessionsvc.exceptions.SessionCleanedUpException - if the previous session cannot be reestablished becuase the clean up timer has expired.

      • disconnect

        public abstract void disconnect(boolean terminateSession)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Disconnects from the cmapi server and terminates active session for this ServiceProvider if the parameter terminateSession is set to true. If the parameter terminateSession is set to false, then the active session is not terminated but the connection to the cmapi server is only disconnected.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • getSessionID

        public abstract java.lang.String getSessionID()
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves the sessionID for this session. Each ServiceProvider has a unique session indentifer for the active session.
        Returns:
        String containing session ID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • getSessionIdList

        public abstract GetSessionIdListResponse getSessionIdList()
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves the list of sessionIDs for this user. Each ServiceProvider has a unique session indentifer for the active session.
        Returns:
        GetSessionIdListResponse containing a list of session ID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • setSessionCharacteristics

        public abstract SetSessionCharacteristicsResponse setSessionCharacteristics(SessionCharacteristics sc)
                                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the SessionCharacteristics of the ServiceProvider session based on the specified characteristics.

        Characteristics is of type com.avaya.csta.binding.SessionCharacteristics. The following characteristics must be set:

        CharacteristicValue
        deviceIDType Valid values are: DMCC (default) or TelURI. DMCC is the type that has been used in previous releases. It expects telephone extensions to be in a format recognized by Communication Manager. TelURI is for applications that use E.164 numbers. This mode only works with Call Control Services, Logical Device Feature Services and Monitoring Services when establishing monitors for those events.
        eventFilterMode Valid values are: None (default) or DesktopCallControl. None corresponds to the standard DMCC behavior. Note that filters specified in a MonitorStart request will continue to be applied. DesktopCallControl is for applications that directly represent call state to end-users.

        There are several benefits to using Tel URI mode as follows:

        • Applications can look up telephone numbers in an enterprise directory and provide those telephone numbers to DMCC without knowledge or concern of the Communication Manager dial plan.
        • The above benefit is extended to numbers external to Communication Manager. The application would not have to be aware of the ARS code to denote an external number, nor would it have to be aware of the international dialing code.
        • The application does not have to be aware of a switchname for the given device. Instead, DMCC will attempt to discover the appropriate Communication Manager instance on receipt of a Monitor Start or Snapshot Device request.

        While this mode can be extremely useful there are several important limitations to be considered prior to using Tel URI mode.

        • Only Monitoring Services, Call Control Services, Snapshot Services and Logical Device Feature Services may be used when working in this mode.
        • If Monitoring Services is used in Tel URI mode, the application must take care to only subscribe to Call Control and Logical Device Feature events.
        • The first request issued by the application must be a Monitor Start or Snapshot Device request as those requests are used to associate the Tel URI with a particular administered Switch.
        • The Dial Plan must have been provisioned in the AE Services OAM pages for the Communication Manager(s) of interest.
        • A given AE Services instance may only serve users in a single country, even if the Communication Manager is a multi-national deployment. This is because the dial plan rules do not take the calling number into account when determining how to convert a called number.

        Desktop Call Control event filtering may be leveraged by applications that are directly representing call state to end-users. In this mode, DMCC will filter out events that would otherwise lead to confusing call states for the user. The following event filtering is applied in this mode:

        • Bridged Appearance Alert provisioning is applied. This provisioning allows the administrator to specify whether applications monitoring a station with bridged appearances of another station should receive Delivered events that would indicate that a bridged appearance is alerting. For example, consider a case where an assistant has bridged appearances of several executives. In some deployments, it may not be desirable for that assistant<92>s call control application to indicate that there is an incoming call for one of these bridged appearances. In other deployments, it may be desirable for the application to alert in this scenario. The Bridged Appearance Alert provisioning allows the administrator to specify which behavior is desired for their particular deployment, and even allows per-user provisioning.

        An example SetSessionCharacteristics message is provided below: 

         ServiceProvider prov = ServiceProvider.getServiceProvider(properties);
 SessionCharacteristics sc = new SessionCharacteristics();
 sc.setdeviceIDType(DeviceIDType.TELURI);
 sc.setEventFilterMode(EventFilterMode.DESKTOPCALLCONTROL);
 SetSessionCharacteristicsResponse resp = prov.setSessionCharacteristics(sc);
        Parameters:
        sc - the SessionCharacteristics
        Returns:
        SetSessionCharacteristicsResponse (an empty response).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • getNegotiatedAPIVersion

        public abstract java.lang.String getNegotiatedAPIVersion()
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrives the API version for the cmapi server. The negotiated API version is the API version which the cmapi server can support on this session.
        Returns:
        API version number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • addServiceProviderListener

        public abstract void addServiceProviderListener(ServiceProviderListener listener)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a ServiceProviderListener for receiving events for the Service Provider. If multiple listeners are added, all listeners will be notified of events. For more information about using listeners see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        Service Provider events include:

        • ServerConenctionDownEvent
        • ServerSessionNotActiveEvent

        When your application no longer wants to be notified of Service Provider events, use the removeServiceProviderListener for each listener that was added.

        Parameters:
        listener - the ServiceProviderListener implementation to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        java.lang.Exception - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeServiceProviderListener

        public abstract void removeServiceProviderListener(ServiceProviderListener listener)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes the specified ServiceProviderListener from receiving events.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ServiceProviderListener to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        java.lang.Exception - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • stopServiceProvider

        public abstract void stopServiceProvider()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        stops the service provider and releases any resources (e.g. threads) associated with it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
